alert.note: Alert for Alcona; Iosco (Michigan) Issued by the National Weather Service

info.headline: Flash Flood Warning issued July 05 at 6:49PM EDT until July 05 at 8:15PM EDT by NWS Gaylord
info.description: ...FLASH FLOOD WARNING REMAINS IN EFFECT UNTIL 815 PM EDT THIS EVENING FOR SOUTHEASTERN ALCONA AND NORTHEASTERN IOSCO COUNTIES... At 649 PM EDT, Rain continues to fall across Alcona and Iosco counties as of 645pm EDT. Rainfall estimates between 2 and 4 inches of rain have fallen since 300pm. Additional rainfall amounts of 0.50 to 1.00 inch are possible between 700pm and 800pm...with more rainfall likely during the mid and late evening hours. HAZARD...Flash flooding caused by thunderstorms. SOURCE...Radar. IMPACT...Flash flooding of small creeks and streams, urban areas, highways, streets and underpasses as well as other poor drainage and low-lying areas is likely. Some locations that will experience flash flooding include... Oscoda and Au Sable This includes the following streams and drainages... Au Sable River tributaries, East Branch Pine River, Loud Creek, Van Etten Creek, and the Pine River. FLASH FLOOD...RADAR INDICATED
info.instruction: Turn around, don`t drown when encountering flooded roads. Most flood deaths occur in vehicles.
